refsect2.title: The "writing-im-msg" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (PurpleAccount *account, const char *who, char **message, PurpleIMConversation *im, PurpleMessageFlags flags, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Emitted before a message is written in an IM conversation. If the message is changed, then the changed message is displayed and logged instead of the original message.

note.para: Make sure to free *message before you replace it!

listitem.simpara: The account.
The name of the user.
A pointer to the message.
The IM conversation.
Flags for this message.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE if the message should be canceled, or FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Emitted when an IM is received. The callback can replace the name of the sender, the message, or the flags by modifying the pointer to the strings and integer. This can also be used to cancel a message by returning TRUE.

A pointer to the username of the sender.
A pointer to the message that was sent.
The IM conversation.
A pointer to the IM message flags.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE if the message should be canceled, or FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Emitted when an account was invited to a chat.
